issue.title: [R] Make expect_dplyr_equal() a bit stricter
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12092](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12092). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Add a `warning_msg = NA` or the like as an argument to `expect_dplyr_equal()` that check + ensures we aren't pulling data into R and then running the dplyr query. 

But will need to re-arrange where warnings like https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/76924612bebb0b3ce0e0cababc5f9be3ce7e6688/r/tests/testthat/test-dplyr-mutate.R#L198 are being expected.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12092?focusedCommentId=17400416) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I did this in ARROW-12994

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12092?focusedCommentId=17585819) by @toddfarmer:*
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
